intro: Galium × grecescui, commonly known as the hybrid wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers clustered in cymes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium × grecescui thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in shaded areas.
